abstract: China, ravenous for energy, is ignoring world's wariness of nuclear power in wake of Fukushima Daiichi disaster, and is poised to build more reactors in coming year than rest of world combined; experts say China could become either savior of the international nuclear power industry, or a ferocious competitor that could create even greater challenges for nuclear power companies in the West.
snippet: Questions abound about whether China will be a savior for the international nuclear power industry or a ferocious competitor.
lead_paragraph: Questions abound about whether China will be a savior for the international nuclear power industry or a ferocious competitor.

headline.main: China Marches On With Nuclear Energy, in Spite of Fukushima
headline.print_headline: As Demand for Electricity Increases, China Sticks With Nuclear Power
